dialogue.title: Standard Search
dialogue.context: General use -- this is in many cases the most frequently used interface component at all.

data.label: database
data.item: The database or folder etc. the query is executed against. The type should be indicated.

data.label: q.regexp
data.item: Allow regexp search, if possible (les imbeciles ne sont pas admis)

action.item: (special case when this is the main window)

action.label: Expert search
action.item: A dialogue is opened which displays extended search options.

dialogue.note:
For an example of a visually appealing query dialogue see the aleph500 main window at http://obelix.ub.uni-siegen.de/
It clearly labels the database against which the search will be executed.
It is possible to have more than one query string in this dialogue; but perhaps a simple dialogue is more appealing here?
